messages.subject: Umbrella strollers
messages.msgSnippet: We are going back to babies after 13 years so equipment has changed alot since then plus the fact that we were in England & now we are here in the US. Does
messages.messageBody:
We are going back to babies after 13 years so equipment has changed
alot since then plus the fact that we were in England & now we are
here in the US. Does anyone know if they manufacture an umbrella
stroller over here that has two adjsutable knobs on the side that
allows the whole seat part to be inclined at whatever angle you
choose? I had a double one of these when my first two were little &
it was awesome as you could lay them flat or any degree of
uprightness you wanted.
We recently purchased a Jogger, via the internet, thinking that we
had done our research pretty thoroughly. This jogger, which is really
nice, was supposed to be fully reclinable. We thought "Fully
reclinable" meant just that, but obviously not as this thing only
reclines so far & is absolutely unsuitable for a newborn. I really
don't want to spend a huge amount of money on another stroller as the
jogger will be great once he is 2-3mths old. Can't use a sling or
Snugli for a long period of time due to back problems & because we
live out in the "boonies" of WV probably won't use it a great deal.
Just want something that we can take to the park or mall etc.
Any ideas or suggestions would be welcome.
Thanks
Liz
